Indonesian: idsurel (standard, shortened of idsurat elektronik (electronic mail)), email (rarely used in everyday spelling, often used in online spelling (e.g. website-based registration or social account))

Malaysian: zsmEaster, zsmPaskah strictly used for Jewish Passover

Indonesian: ideditor, idpenyunting, idredaktur (from French frrédacteur through Dutch – refers to editors of mass printed media)
idHari Raya Idulfitri – Idul Fitri nonstandard spelling, but common, idLebaran colloquial – from Javanese

Malaysian: zsmlapan used as colloquial abbreviation in Indonesian
Indonesian: iddelapan used in Malaysia before the spelling reform

Malaysian: zsmsekatan (means "obstacle" or "room which separated with partition" in Indonesian)
zsmkecemasan (used for anxiety or "too anxious" (condition) in Indonesian)
Indonesian: iddarurat (from Arabic – also used in Malaysia to express a state of emergency), idkegawatan
idknalpot (from Dutch, in which it also means muffler")"
idpaparan, idekspos, idpendedahan (virtually never used in Indonesia, listed by KBBI)
idpadam (of flame or light), idpunah (of species), idpupus (loss of hope)
